zendesk.suas

Class MonitorMiddleware

  • java.lang.Object
    • zendesk.suas.MonitorMiddleware
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Middleware

    public class MonitorMiddleware
extends java.lang.Object
implements Middleware
    Middleware for logging State changes to Suas Monitor

    Create an instance using the default constructor: 

     Middleware monitor = new MonitorMiddleware(context);
    or using the builder for more configuration options: 
     Middleware logger = new MonitorMiddleware.Builder(context)
      .withEnableBonjour(true)
      .withEnableAdb(false)
      .build()
    Make sure the the monitor is the last middleware in the list: 
     Middleware monitor = new MonitorMiddleware(context)

 Store store = Suas.createStore(...)
       .widthMiddleware(middleware1, middleware2, ... middlewareN, monitor)
       .builder().

        public MonitorMiddleware(@NonNull

        * Create a LoggerMiddleware with default parameters.

        ADB and Bonjour are enabled in the default configuration.

    • Method Detail

      • onAction

        public void onAction(@NonNull
                     Action<?> action,
                     @NonNull
                     GetState state,
                     @NonNull
                     Dispatcher dispatcher,
                     @NonNull
                     Continuation continuation)
        Description copied from interface: Middleware
        Called before an Action gets passed to the Reducers.

        Examples: Log state changes: 

         void onAction(...) {
    State oldState = state.getState();
    continuation.next(action);
    State newState = state.getState();

    System.out.println(stateDiff(oldState, newState));
 }
        Consume an Action and dispatch it on a background thread: 
         void onAction(...) {
    if(action.getData() instanceof AsyncAction) {
        // consume action
        backgroundTask.start(action.getData, dispatcher);
    } else {
        continuation.next(action);
    }
 }
        Specified by:
        onAction in interface Middleware
        Parameters:
        action - a dispatched action
        state - access to the current state
        dispatcher - access to the dispatcher for dispatching a new action
        continuation - callback for passing the action to the next middleware

      • handle

                   java.io.OutputStream outputStream)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
